refnamediv.refpurpose: Fetch all rows from a result as an array

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: pg_fetch_all returns an array that contains all rows (tuples/records) in result resource. It returns &false;, if there are no rows.
See also pg_fetch_row, pg_fetch_array, pg_fetch_object and pg_fetch_result.

example.title: PostgreSQL fetch all
example.programlisting:
<?php 
$conn = pg_pconnect ("dbname=publisher");
if (!$conn) {
    echo "An error occured.\n";
    exit;
}

$result = pg_query ($conn, "SELECT * FROM authors");
if (!$result) {
    echo "An error occured.\n";
    exit;
}

$arr = pg_fetch_all ($result);

var_dump($arr);

?>
